Text:
The Clovers haven't come back? Is that what you're
telling me?

Gettan falls deep into thought after hearing the
report.

Y-Yes, sir. Even those we sent as reinforcements...
We've lost contact with our surveillance team as
well...

Lord Gettan, some within the MCA have aligned
themselves with Mitsugoshi. Because of this recent
setback...ah, I mean, incident, they've grown
increasingly restless...
Silence them.
Ack... Ngh!
Y-Yes sir.

Gettan's sightless gaze tracks Garter as the latter
bows and leaves.

Leaf One, Leaf Two, and Leaf Three were all
formidable dark knights.

They wouldn't have been good enough to make it into
the Cult's upper echelons, but anyone else would
easily consider them masters.
Yet they didn't come back.

They may have been known as the Clovers, but
ultimately, they were nothing more than bandits
who couldn't make the cut for the Knight Order.

Having the Children on standby would have been ideal,
but the Cult's numbers are also dwindling.

Zenon and that old relic continue to be a pain in my
side even after they're gone.

That said, this is the perfect opportunity for me to
demonstrate my power...

The MCA is merely a pawn... So long as they hold
together until my plans are underway, that's all
that matters.
Just a little longer.
Just a little more...
In that instant, his memories come rushing back.

Both the Spirit Fox and the Great Wolf villages were
annihilated in a single night.
If only I had more power...
I could have stopped it...
Power...!
I will obtain power that cannot be taken from me!
(Fall has ended, and winter has begun.)

(I dutifully play out my role at school as a
background character as I wait for the
counterfeits to be finished.)

(If everything goes well, we'll be able to cash out
the counterfeits and make mad bank.)

(Man, the thought makes even these boring days of
mine feel brilliant and wonderful.)

(In the middle of all this, I'm being forcibly dragged
into a mock battle with Alexia.)
...Haaah!
(Wait...Has she always been this strong?)

(Now that I think about it, it's been a long time
since the last time I watched her fight.)
*sigh*

You're looking good there. And you'll probably keep
improving too.
That's just my opinion as an amateur, though.
Thanks.

(It feels like she's had some sort of mental shift,
or like she's finally figured something out. It makes
sense. Those tend to be the kinds of things that spur
on rapid growth.)

But it still isn't enough yet. I need to become
stronger.
Okay.
You're supposed to ask why.
Why?
All I could do was stand by and watch...
Rose left on her own.

Without its king, Oriana Kingdom is now in
shambles... And Rose, she...
My friend is suffering, and I...

I need more power, and I'm lacking in many other
areas. In the shadows of our peaceful lives, the
world is ever changing.
If we stand still, we're sure to be left behind.
I don't want to just be a bystander anymore.
I see.
It's funny, though.

Ever since I began acting on my own, it seems like
the days just fly by.
That's just how it goes, I guess.
I'm happy you're able to act so carefree about it.

I hope that you never have to change those carefree
ways of yours.
Heh.
Alexia grins mischievously.

Now that winter has come, it is starting to get cold
at night. Cid walks briskly back to his dorm, changes
into his John Smith outfit, and makes for a quiet alley.
(I've arranged to meet someone here.)

Add a topping of chashu pork with no fat, extra
vegetables, and garlic.
Coming right up.
There, Cid finds a therianthrope with brown cat ears.
The goods are complete.
It's Natsu, one of Yukime’s attendants.
Heh... It's finally here!
Enjoy!
